alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 14 at 5:29PM EDT until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Wake. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 527 PM EDT, First round of heavy rain is moving out, but another cluster of strong storms will move into the area and may cause minor flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in isolated spots. Another 1 to 2 inches will be possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, Wake Forest, Garner, Zebulon, RDU International, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Knightdale, Wendell, Rolesville, Lake Benson, William B Umstead State Park, Lake Wheeler, Falls Lake Boat Ramp, Purnell and Falls Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
